instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG? PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG is a single phase of CPU VCORE before it is combined into PPVCORE_S0_CPU .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime but no boot
threads.message:
Hello guys,

I just got a new board which has no apple logo on startup. It chimes, video is there, the fan is spinning and VCore is present. But it doesn't boot.
When I measure the power rails, I get only [B]0.8V[/B] on [B]<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG</SIGNAL> ([/B]instead of 1.25V). I thought there could be an issue with <TRANSISTOR>Q7510</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7520</TRANSISTOR>, so I replaced them but nothing changed. Does someone have a clue?

Thanks a lot!!!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime but no boot
threads.message:
Do a PRAM reset first....
Also hold Alt key on start up to see if you can get to boot menu

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime but no boot
threads.message:
Hello,

thank you, you were right! By pressing the alt key, I was able run the ASD EFI Test which passed (after 1 hour - slowest part of the test were the memory tests).
The thing now is, that I can't install OSX because its so so slow. The mouse is lagging and everything takes way too long.
When I check the sensor readings in the ASD EFI, I can't find a sensor which seems [B]not[/B] normal - everything looks fine.
Does anyone have an idea what could cause this?

Thank you!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime but no boot
threads.message: These must have the correct battery connected. Battery model A1405

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime but no boot
threads.message:
Ok thank you, I forgot to mention that the battery was dead because I thought this couldnâ€˜t be the problem.
I will put in a new battery and keep you informed.

Thanks for your help!
